casebody.data:
James W. SPRADING, Appellant, v. UNITED STATES of America, Appellee. No. 11340. United States Court of Appeals District of Columbia Circuit. Argued June 10, 1952. Decided June 26, 1952. Writ of Certiorari Denied Oct. 20, 1952. See 73 S.Ct. 100. Samuel Green, Washington, D. G, appointed by the District Court, for appellant. Lewis A. Carroll, Asst. U. S. Atty., Washington, D. G, with whom Charles M. Irelan, U. S. Atty., Joseph M. Ploward and Thomas A. Flannery, Asst. U. S. Attys., Washington, D. G, were on the brief, for appellee.

Before EDGERTON, FAHY, and WASHINGTON, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

The judgment is affirmed on the authority of Holloway v. United States, 80 U.S.App.D.C. 3, 148 F.2d 665.

Affirmed.
